item_title: CALL TO ORDER and ROLL CALL

item_blurb: Public comments that are not related to any of the items specifically listed on the agenda will be heard at approximately 9:00 am, for no more than one hour. At the discretion of the Chair, speakers may be given up to 2 minutes. Due to the transition to a virtual meeting platform, the Coastal Commission at this time will not allow for the ceding of time from one speaker to another speaker. Note: You may address the Commission on a specific topic one time only each month. Please submit a request to speak by 5:00 pm the day before the hearing to assist with meeting management sign up. We will stop taking speaker requests by 8:30 am on each day of the meeting. Please see the Coastal Commission’s Virtual Hearing Procedures memo for submitting a request to speak.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: Status report and possible action on pending legislation (KH/SC-SF)

subitem_title: SONGS
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director's determination to transition to a reduced monitoring scheme for Southern California Edison's San Onofre Nuclear Generating Station (SONGS) mitigation reef. (RP-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0218 (1st Avenue Palisades LLC, Santa Monica)
subitem_blurb: Application of 1st Avenue Palisades LLC to remodel and add 184 sq.ft. to existing 3-story, 40-ft. tall, 9,560 sq.ft. single-family home on 9,802 sq.ft. lot at 609 Palisades Beach Road, Santa Monica, Los Angeles County. (CS-LB)

subitem_title: University of California Santa Barbara Notice of Impending Development No. UCS-NOID-0001-24 (Building 7035 Demolition).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on Notice of Impending Development by the University of California Santa Barbara for the demolition of a 720 sq. ft. one-story classroom, stairway, and trellis structure, on the Devereux Campus at the University of California Santa Barbara, Santa Barbara County. (SF-V)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Ventura office at (805) 585-1800.

subitem_title: City of Malibu Local Coastal Program Amendment No. LCP-4-MAL-21-0049-1-Part B (Sign Regulations).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the City of Malibu’s request to amend the Land Use Plan and Implementation Plan portions of its certified LCP to delete or modify policies and provisions that apply to signs on beachfront properties. (BC-V)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-4-SBV-24-0003 (Guthrie, San Buenaventura)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Dennis and Cheryl Heitmann, Glenn Ross, and Robert Myman from decision of the City of San Buenaventura granting permit with conditions to Brian Guthrie for 3,741 sq.ft. two and a half-story single-family home with garage, retaining wall, driveway, hardscape, landscaping, grading, and sand export, at 1153 Bath Lane, City of San Buenaventura, Ventura County. (DG-V)

subitem_title: Permit No. P-10-1-76-9059-A1 (Seider, Malibu)
subitem_blurb: Request by Dennis and Leah Seider to amend previously approved permit for beachfront single-family home to include the placement of one 18 in. by 24 in. metal sign on the seaward side of the residence that says: “Public access extends 25 ft. landward of the mean high tide line; no public access allowed on the private property from there to the house”, at 26642 Latigo Shore Drive, Malibu, Los Angeles County. (BC-V)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report For Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Permit No. A-62-81-A2 (Snapshot Partners, LLC, Venice, Los Angeles)
subitem_blurb: Request by Snapshot Partners, LLC to amend previously granted permit to construct 5,355 sq. ft. rooftop deck with 42 in. guardrail and associated roof access structures (no increase in existing height), improve interior elevator and staircases, and modify underground parking spaces and changes to public parking rates and availability, in part to resolve Coastal Act violations at 911 Ocean Front Walk in Venice, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County. (JP-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Permit No 5-07-343-A3 (Macerich SMP, LP, Santa Monica)
subitem_blurb: Request by Macerich SMP, LP to amend previously granted permit to convert 3,157 sq. ft. of existing 5,700 sq. ft. public food court deck to restaurant patio dining area and reduce the required number of offsite parking spaces from 482 to 354 spaces at 395 Santa Monica Place, Santa Monica, Los Angeles County. (CS-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

item_title: Note: For items w15.1 to w15.4, please email all comments to Aaron.McLendon@coastal.ca.gov
Consent Cease and Desist Order No. CCC-24-CD-01 (Legado Companies, Playa del Rey, Los Angeles Co.)
item_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed administrative consent order directing and authorizing Legado Companies to: cease and desist from undertaking unpermitted development, including use of heavy equipment, removal of major vegetation, grading of sand dunes, and blocking or impeding public access across public access easement, on two undeveloped, sandy beach lots located at 6819 Pacific Ave., immediately landward of Toes Beach in Playa del Rey (Los Angeles County Assessor Parcel Numbers 4116-003-001 and 4116-003-006) (AM-SF)

item_title: Consent Restoration Order No. CCC-24-RO-01 (Legado Companies, Playa del Rey, Los Angeles Co.)
item_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on proposed consent administrative order directing and authorizing Legado Companies to: 1) take restorative actions at the site of its unpermitted development, including: removal, erosion control, and revegetation activities; 2) provide additional mitigation and ecological enhancement where the unpermitted development occurred and on surrounding areas to address temporal losses of habitat; and 3) implement a long-term monitoring program to address impacts of unpermitted development, including: use of heavy equipment on the properties, removal of major vegetation, including native dune vegetation, grading of sand dunes, and temporarily blocking public access across a public access easement, on two undeveloped, sandy beach lots located at 6819 Pacific Ave., immediately landward of Toes Beach in Playa del Rey (Los Angeles County Assessor Parcel Numbers 4116-003-001 and 4116-003-006) (AM-SF)

item_title: Consent Administrative Penalty No. CCC-24-AP-01 (Legado Companies, Playa del Rey, Los Angeles Co.)
item_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on: 1) proposed imposition of consent administrative civil penalties, and 2) proposed requirement to provide additional mitigation (beyond what is required by the restoration order described above) in lieu of a further monetary payment, for violations of the public access provisions of the Coastal Act that occurred on two undeveloped, sandy beach lots located at 6819 Pacific Ave., immediately landward of Toes Beach in Playa del Rey (Los Angeles County Assessor Parcel Numbers 4116-003-001 and 4116-003-006) (AM-SF)

item_title: Consent Administrative Penalty No. CCC-24-AP3-01 (Legado Companies, Playa del Rey, Los Angeles Co.)
item_blurb: Public hearing and Commission action on: 1) proposed imposition of consent administrative civil penalties, and 2) proposed requirement to provide additional mitigation (beyond what is required by the restoration order described above) in lieu of a further monetary penalty, for violations of the non-public access-related provisions of the Coastal Act that occurred on two undeveloped, sandy beach lots located at 6819 Pacific Ave., immediately landward of Toes Beach in Playa del Rey (Los Angeles County Assessor Parcel Numbers 4116-003-001 and 4116-003-006) (AM-SF)
At a convenient time during the meeting, the Commission (CCC) will have a closed session to discuss items of pending litigation, including:

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0587 (Skovseth, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Erik Skovseth to remove existing 367 sq.ft. floating dock and install 353 sq.ft. floating dock. One existing 14 in. square concrete pile will remain and one 14 in. square concrete pile will be relocated, while existing gangway will remain in place and be re-used, at 8 Collins Isle, Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB).

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0879 (RLB 20212 Irrevocable Trust, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of RLB 20212 Irrevocable Trust to relocate existing 1,380 sq. ft. dock float and four 18-in. wide square piles and replacement of dock float decking at 12 Bay Island, Newport Beach, Orange County. (CS-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0181 (8 Bayshore Partnership, LP C/O Invest Buidling Group, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of 8 Bayshore Partnership, LP C/O Invest Buidling Group to remove existing 1,711 sq.ft. wooden floating dock with  new 1,623 sq.ft. Bluewater aluminum dock at 2676 Bashore Drive, Newport Beach, Orange County. (ETP-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0507 (Manly, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of John Manly to remove existing 445 sq.ft. floating dock, 66 sq.ft. gangway, and two 14” concrete pipe piles; and construct new 441 sq.ft. floating dock, 72 sq.ft. gangway, and install two new 14” concrete pipe piles at 7 Linda Isle, Newport Beach, Orange County. (ETP-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0869 (Roberts, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Todd & Kelly Roberts for after-the-fact approval of demolition of cantilevered deck and construction of new 57 ft., 6-in. long concrete deck cantilevered 5 ft. beyond the bulkhead, with 42-in. high, bird safe railing along perimeter of deck, at 3872 Sirius Dr., Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-21-0900 (Vishwanath & Sherman, Surfside-Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Vishwanath & Leela Hamas Sherman for significant remodel and addition to existing one-story, 1,028 sq.ft. single-family home with an attached 385 sq.ft. two-car garage with 947 sq.ft. of habitable area above located on two floors resulting in a three-story, 3,682 sq.ft. single-family home with attached 385 sq.ft. two-car garage, at 55B Surfside, Surfside-Seal Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0739 (MAAT Investments LLC, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of MAAT Investments LLC (Attn: Mercy Cordero) to remove existing 484 sq.ft. left slip and replace with a new 488 sq. ft. dock slip. Remove and replace one 14 in. square guide pile. Remove existing 3.5 ft. by 20 ft. gangway and install new 3 ft. by 24 ft. gangway. Existing right slip and three guide piles to remain at 62 Linda Isle, Newport Beach, Orange County. (EG-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-23-0461 (San Diego Hollister Quarry Mitigation, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of San Diego to restore approximately 0.88 acres of wetland habitat within the Coastal Zone as mitigation for impacts from previous emergency channel maintenance located within Otay River watershed east of Hollister St. and between Main St. and Palm Ave., Otay Mesa/Nestor, San Diego, San Diego County. (CJ-SD)

subitem_title: Application No. 6-23-0515 (General Dynamics NASSCO, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of General Dynamics NASSCO to install mooring dolphin with 2,070 sq. ft, 6-ft. deep concrete pad, 56 24-in. piles, and attached fender system, at 2798 East Harbor Drive, San Diego, San Diego County. (ML-SD)

item_blurb: Report by the Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, negative determinations, matters not requiring public hearings, and status report on offshore oil & gas exploration & development.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Energy, Ocean Resources, and Federal Consistency Division office at (415) 904-5240.
subitem_title: Deputy Director's Report
subitem_blurb: Negative determination by the Federal Railroad Administration for approval of a Railroad Rehabilitation and Improvement Financing loan to Mendocino Railway for its Railroad Rehabilitation Project that, generally, includes re-opening a collapsed tunnel, replacing up to 34,000 railroad ties and lines, purchasing rolling stock, and rehabilitating bridges to bring into use an approximately 35-mile stretch of rail line between Willits and Fort Bragg that has been out of service since 2015, Mendocino County. (CT-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 9-23-0599 (Pacific Gas & Electric Company, San Luis Obispo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by PG&E to dredge approximately 70,000 cu. yds. of sediment from the Diablo Canyon Power Plant Intake Cove, approximately six miles north of the City of Avila Beach, and place dredged sediment approx. 2,000 ft. offshore of Morro Bay State Park sandspit, San Luis Obispo County. (JK-SF) (Note: the Commission's enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as referenced in the staff report.)

subitem_title: Application No. 9-21-0339 (San Diego Gas and Electric Company, San Diego Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application by SDG&E to fire-harden transmission lines located on Marine Corps Base Camp Pendleton by replacing wood poles with steel poles, install maintenance pads, and make other line improvements. (HM-SF).
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Consistency Determination No. CD-0001-23 (U.S. Forest Service, San Luis Obispo Co.)
subitem_blurb: Consistency Determination by the United States Forest Service (USFS) for a proposed temporary two-year prohibition on overnight camping, campfires, and off-leash dogs at Big Sur's San Carpoforo Beach, San Luis Obispo County. (TL-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-5-LGB-23-0047 (Laguna Royale, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Catherine Jurca from decision of City of Laguna Beach granting permit with conditions to Laguna Royale HOA for repair of approximately 15,600 sq.ft. of elevated deck area and removal and replacement of deck railings with glass guardrails at all units and common area decks and after-the-fact coastal development permit for repairs and modifications to the structures and individual units, completed with design review permits and/or building permits, from 1989 through 2022, at 31423 So. Coast Highway, Laguna Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-22-0933 (Harris, San Clemente)
subitem_blurb: Application of Elizabeth Harris to demolish existing 2,633 sq.ft. one-story single-family home and detached 779 sq.ft. garage and construct  new 5,343 sq.ft. two-story over basement single-family home with 1,019 sq. ft. two car subterranean garage and 1,049 sq. ft. roof top deck with overall height of approximately 16 ft. at 2407 Plaza A La Playa, San Clemente, Orange County. (EG-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0345 (NMUSD, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Newport-Mesa Unified School District (NMUSD) to replace existing playground including new playground equipment and associated grading and site work including new playground surfacing and masonry site walls, at 1327 West Ocean Front, Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0409 (Huntington Beach Wetlands Conservancy, Huntington Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Huntington Beach Wetlands Conservancy for restoration within Talbert Marsh including measures to address erosion that has degraded marsh habitat along the southeastern shoreline and on the west bank of South Island within Talbert Marsh. Proposed work includes placement of fiber mat, filter fabric, cobble, gravel, soil or gravel sills, coir logs, and marsh plantings and non-native plant removal. Proposed project includes a Biological Monitoring Plan and a Physical Monitoring Plan, at Talbert Marsh (inland of Pacific Coast Highway, upcoast of the Santa Ana River), Huntington Beach, Orange County. (MV-LB)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 5-23-0482 (City of Seal Beach, Seal Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Seal Beach for implementation of new short-term residential rental program, applicable to most housing units in the Coastal Zone, located within the City’s Coastal Zone, Seal Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CAR-23-0048-1 (ADU 2023 Update). Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the request by City of Carlsbad to amend its Implementation Plan to ensure consistency with state laws related to accessory dwelling units and junior accessory dwelling units. (CJ-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CAR-23-0049-1 (Alternative and Temporary Housing). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the request by City of Carlsbad to amend its Implementation Plan to address alternative housing and housing for persons experiencing homelessness. (CJ-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CAR-23-0050-1 (Citywide Objective Design Standards). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the request by City of Carlsbad to amend its Implementation Plan to establish citywide objective design standards for multifamily housing and mixed-use development projects.  (CJ-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CVR-23-0051-1 (Village & Barrio Objective Design Standards). Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on the request by City of Carlsbad to amend the Village and Barrio Master Plan to establish objective design standards for multifamily housing and mixed-use development projects in the Village and Barrio neighborhoods.  (CJ-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CCP-23-0014-1 (Midway-Pacific Highway Height Limit).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Land Development Code (IP) to revise the Height Limit Ordinance, which limits building height to 30 ft. in the Coastal Zone, to exclude the Midway-Pacific Highway Community Plan Area. (ML-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-23-0027-2 (Housing Action Package).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Local Coastal Program to amend various chapters of the Land Development Code (IP) addressing housing and accessory dwelling units to allow for additional residential density through implementation of Senate Bill 9. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-23-0052-3 (Housing Action Package ADU Amendment).
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Land Development Code (IP) to change the amount of time an accessory dwelling unit must be deed-restricted as very low-income or low-income housing in order to qualify for an additional accessory dwelling unit is de minimis. (AL-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-OMN-23-0053-4 (Bella Mar Rezone). Time Extension.
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 90-day time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by City of San Diego to update the Otay Mesa-Nestor Community Plan (Land Use Plan) and to change the land use designation from Open Space to Medium Density Residential on a 14.62-acre site to facilitate the construction of 380 apartment units. (TR-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. 6-22-0196 (San Diego El Camino Real Bridge/Road Replacement, San Diego)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of San Diego to demolish 2-lane bridge over the San Dieguito River and construct new 4-lane, 354 ft. long, 76 ft. wide bridge; realign and widen El Camino Real between San Dieguito Road and Via de la Valle; construct new intersection at El Camino Real and De la Valle Place; construct new medians, protected bike lanes, landscaping , multi-modal trail connections; and relocate the Coastal Zone Boundary up to 70 yds. inland, at El Camino Real, North City, San Diego, San Diego County. (ME-SD)

subitem_title: Permit No. 6-22-0959-A1 (Loews Coronado Bay Resort and California State Parks, Coronado)
subitem_blurb: Application of Loews Coronado Bay Resort and California State Parks to amend permit to seasonally place beach hut in the public parking lot and chairs/umbrellas on the beach, and provide limited food/beverage service during the summer for hotel guests and the public, to extend the permit term for three years, at Silver Strand State Beach, Coronado, San Diego County. (ML-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS

subitem_title: Application No. 1-22-0358 (Parks & Rec., Stagecoach Hill Azalea Nature Trail Accessibility Improvements, Humboldt Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Department of Parks & Recreation North Coast Redwoods District to improve to accessibility standards an approx. 0.5-mile-long nature trail by widening and improving existing trail segments, decommissioning and rerouting trail segments, adding retaining walls, installing ADA-compliant parking stall, wooden bench, and signage, replacing culvert, and enhancing adjacent habitat to mitigate for rare plant impacts, at Stagecoach Hill Azalea Nature Trail, Humboldt Lagoons State Park, Humboldt County. (CM-A)

subitem_title: Appeal No. A-1-HUM-23-0030 (Schneider, Humboldt Co.).
subitem_blurb: Appeal by Commissioners Brownsey & Hart of decision of County of Humboldt granting permit modification with conditions to Travis Schneider to (1) demolish and remove 21,000 sq. ft. partially built residential structure, driveway, retaining walls, and 15,000 cu. yds. of fill material; (2) restore habitat areas and install protective fencing, and (3) adjust lot lines between two parcels resulting in two vacant parcels of 2.45 acres and 3.65 acres, at 1506 & 1512 Walker Point Rd., Bayside, Humboldt County. (MBK-A) (Note: the Commission’s enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as explained further in the staff report.)
subitem_status: SUBSTANTIAL ISSUE FOUND, de Novo Hearing CONTINUED

subitem_title: Application No. 1-24-0047 (California Department of Technology , Middle-Mile Broadband Network Project, Del Norte Co., Humboldt Co.& Mendocino Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of California Department of Transportation on behalf of California Department of Technology to construct segments of the Middle-Mile Broadband Network (MMBN) along approximately 130 miles of State Highways 101, 1, 199, 255, 211, 20, and 128, including installation of conduit, fiber optic cable, and vaults below ground surface, and two above-ground hub shelters and associated development near Fort Bragg and Manchester within State Highway right-of-way. (MP-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report. subitem_title: Public Works Plan No. PWP-2-MAR-24-0001-1 (Tomales Bay State Park Forest Health and Wildfire Resilience Public Works Plan).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on California State Parks proposed Public Works Plan that would allow a 10-year vegetation treatment program designed to enhance ecosystems and improve wildfire resilience (in tandem and pursuant to the State Board of Forestry’s certified California Vegetation Treatment Program Programmatic Environmental Impact Report) in Tomales Bay State Park within the Marin Couty coastal zone. (MM-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 2-17-0438 (AMJT Capital, Bolinas, Marin Co.)
subitem_blurb: Application of AMJT Capital, LLC to redevelop and expand approx. 170-ft long seawall, associated fronting revetment, and connecting public access stairway and ramp, on beach fronting single-family home; and request for after-the-fact authorization of unpermitted development in the form of expansion of the seawall and private development on public property, at 100 Brighton Ave. in unincorporated community of Bolinas, Marin County. (Note: the Commission's enforcement division has opened an investigation into potential Coastal Act violations associated with this item and site, as referenced in the staff report.) (DC/SR-SF)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, local government acceptance of modifications for LCP certification and on comments from the public relating to the Deputy Director's report.  For specific information contact the Commission’s Santa Cruz office at (831) 427-4863.

subitem_title: City of Morro Bay LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-MRB-22-0059-2 (Morro Bay IP Update).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by the City of Morro Bay to comprehensively update the LCP’s Implementation Plan and to make minor amendments to the Land Use Map, and if the Commission does not take a final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (SM-SC)

subitem_title: City of Santa Cruz LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-STC-23-0046-2 Part B (Historic Incentives).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and potential action on request by the City of Santa Cruz to amend the LCP’s Implementation Plan to modify certain development standards for historic structures, including changes to incentivize historic preservation and to account  for EV charging stations, and if the Commission does not take final action, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (KF-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: City of Santa Cruz LCP Amendment No. LCP-3-STC-23-0047-2 Part C (Parking Updates).
subitem_blurb: Public hearing to determine whether the Commission concurs with the Executive Director’s determination that the request by the City of Santa Cruz to amend its certified LCP Implementation Plan to modify bike parking requirements, incorporate changes to automobile requirements as required by state law, and update other minor related parking standards is de minimis and thus should be approved as submitted, and if the Commission objects to such determination, possible action to extend the deadline for final Commission action on the amendment. (KF-SC)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent, Approved as Recommended

subitem_title: Application No. A-3-SCO-23-0051 (Kozlowski/Lacerte Armoring, Rio Del Mar)
subitem_blurb: Application by Kirk Kozlowski and Mary Lacerte to construct a 110 linear ft. buried pin pier retaining wall and associated drainage improvements within and on top of a coastal bluff on the seaward side of 266 Cliff Court in the Rio Del Mar area of unincorporated Santa Cruz County. (NC-SC)
